definition: to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: The contract stipulates that staff must be paid for working overtime.
sentences.chinese: 合约中明订员工加班可请领加班费。

sentences.english: The procedure should be completed before final exams scheduled on the school calendar.
sentences.chinese: 休学手续应于校曆明订之学期考试前办妥。
